distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
notes.title: Title of the patch

notes.text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 SP3 kernel was updated to receive the following security fixes:

- CVE-2017-1000251: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel was
  vulnerable to a stack overflow while processing L2CAP configuration
  responses, resulting in a potential remote denial-of-service vulnerability
  but no remote code execution due to use of CONFIG_CC_STACKPROTECTOR.
  [bnc#1057389]
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

document.title: Security update for the Linux Kernel

notes.text: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel (BlueZ), starting at the Linux kernel version 2.6.32 and up to and including 4.13.1, are vulnerable to a stack overflow vulnerability in the processing of L2CAP configuration responses resulting in Remote code execution in kernel space.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12 SP3:kernel-default-4.4.82-6.6.1.x86_64
SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop 12 SP3:kernel-default-devel-4.4.82-6.6.1.x86_64
